fields.value: Land and Soil Health Assessment in the Maringa-Lopori-Wamba (MLW) Landscape, Djolu, Yamboyo, DRC as part of the CARPE Phase II-Sustainable Opportunities for Improving Livelihoods Project

authorAffiliation.value: International Center for Tropical Agriculture - CIAT
International Institute of Tropical Agriculture - IITA

dsDescriptionValue.value: During the Phase II of the SOIL project in the Maringa-Lopori-Wamba Landscape, a wide range of activities were implemented during the 2011- 2013 in order to develop and expand sustainable agriculture activities within the landscape. This report highlights the land and soil health assessment that was carried out to inform these and future activities using the Land Degradation Surveillance Framework (LDSF).

files.description: This report highlights the sampling methodology and key results of the soil health indicators. Predictions results using MIR are also reported. Preliminary analysis on the effect of land cover on dynamic soil properties are also included.
files.label: AWF_LDSF_Soil2_sm.pdf

dataFile.description: This report highlights the sampling methodology and key results of the soil health indicators. Predictions results using MIR are also reported. Preliminary analysis on the effect of land cover on dynamic soil properties are also included.

files.description: Description of the variables in the LDSF data file.
files.label: ldsf_description of codesv3.xlsx

dataFile.description: Description of the variables in the LDSF data file.

files.description: The Land Degradation Surveillance Framework (LDSF) is designed to provide a biophysical baseline at landscape level, and a monitoring and evaluation framework for assessing processes of land degradation and the effectiveness of rehabilitation measures (recovery) over time. This field guide describes the LDSF field survey methods and is designed to be used in both training and as a reference in field, during survey campaigns.
files.label: ldsfFieldGuide_2013_v4.pdf

dataFile.description: The Land Degradation Surveillance Framework (LDSF) is designed to provide a biophysical baseline at landscape level, and a monitoring and evaluation framework for assessing processes of land degradation and the effectiveness of rehabilitation measures (recovery) over time. This field guide describes the LDSF field survey methods and is designed to be used in both training and as a reference in field, during survey campaigns.
